result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Andrew Stevens III

records.addlTxt:
11:00 AM Attorney Zachary L Brost in court for State of Wisconsin. . Defendant Andrew Stevens III in court with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz. Clerk N. Nobile.
MINUTES: Victim rights compliance. Attorney Schwarz advises the Court that matter is resolved, but the agreement is for probation and with Defendant living in the State of Illinois he needs to save up some funds for the transfer fee. Court adjourns.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 9, 2022 at 11:00 am.

09:58 AM
Defendant, Andrew Stevens, appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.
Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.
Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment and plea/sent. date.
Matter set over, bond continued.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for September 15, 2022 at 11:00 am.

08:36 AM Defendant, Andrew Stevens, appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.
Attorney Zachary L Brost appeared for the Prosecution.  Court Reporter:  Kimberly Keel.  Clerk:  JM.
MINUTES:
Victim rights compliance.
Defense Attorney requesting an adjournment, needs more time.
Matter set over, bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for August 4, 2022 at 09:45 am.

Defendant, Andrew Stevens, appeared with Attorney Benjamin L Schwarz.  Attorney Andrew Joseph Burgoyne appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  DE waives preliminary hearing; probable cause found.  Case bound over.   Information filed, reading waived.  Not guilty plea entered.  Bond continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
